intro: Hedeoma palmeri var. zaragozana, commonly known as the Zaragoza hedge-nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, hairy fruits. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
